lead_paragraph: Many Brazilians feel they have more important things to worry about, including soaring unemployment, a plummeting currency and a corruption scandal.

headline.print_headline: Zika? Partying Brazilians Offer Collective Shrug
headline.main: Brazilians Shrug Off Zika Fears to Revel in Carnival Fun

snippet: Many Brazilians feel they have more important things to worry about, including soaring unemployment, a plummeting currency and a corruption scandal.
abstract: Millions of Brazilians take to streets to celebrate Carnival, seemingly unconcerned about threat posed by Zika virus, despite deepening fears across Americas in wake of World Health Organization announcement that virus is global emergency; lack of concern has alarmed public health officials, who are working to curb outbreak in country; for many Brazilians, virus is far less worrisome than larger problems like endemic corruption, soaring unemployment and faltering currency.
